intro: Scirpus emarginatus, commonly known as the narrowleaf bulrush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland environments in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family. This plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, forming dense stands that help stabilize shorelines. Its tall, cylindrical inflorescence consists of spikelets that produce small, wind-pollinated flowers. Scirpus emarginatus plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various aquatic and wetland organisms.
